caption:
Table 1: The MOS and CMOS comparisons between previous TTS systems and human recordings. 
Note that the Wilcoxon p-value in MOS is conducted using Wilcoxon rank sum test [30], instead 
of the Wilcoxon signed rank test in CMOS, due to no paired comparison in MOS evaluation. For 
Grad-TTS, we use 1000 steps for inference.

Table 2: MOS comparison between NaturalSpeech and human recordings. Wilcoxon rank sum test is 
used to measure the p-value in MOS evaluation.

4.3 Comparison with Previous TTS Systems
